summary: Marrakesh is the fourth-largest city in Morocco and one of its four imperial cities. Founded in 1070, it was a major cultural and trading center. Known as the "Red City" due to its red sandstone buildings, it flourished under different dynasties. After a decline, it revived in the 16th century and became popular among Sufi pilgrims. Today, Marrakesh is a bustling economic hub and tourist attraction, famous for its medina (old city), markets, and historic sites. It's also a popular spot for French celebrities. The city has an international airport, universities, and is home to several sports clubs.
title: Marrakesh
